docs.title: MA2221 – Foundational Mathematics for Machine Learning
docs.text:
Instructor: Biswarup Biswas Mahindra University

Class Timings: - Lecture: Tue 9:25–10:20, Wed 10:35–11:30, Thu 2:35–3:30 (Room: ELT6) - Lab: Monday 3:35–5:30 (Computer Lab 3)

docs.title: Lectures
docs.text: No Date Topic Slides 1 20-01-2026 Introduction to Machine Learning and Models 2 21-01-2026 Scalars, Vectors, and Matrices

docs.title: Module 1 — Introduction
docs.text: Class 1 - Machine learning as function approximation and data fitting - Training, prediction, and model error - Why geometry, probability, and optimization matter

docs.title: Module 2 — Linear Algebra for Data
docs.text: Class 2 – Vectors and data representation in high dimensions Class 3 – Linear maps as feature transformations Class 4 – Rank, conditioning, and stability of models Class 5 – Subspaces as hypothesis spaces Class 6 – Basis change and coordinate systems Class 7 – Null spaces and information loss Class 8 – Geometry of linear transformations

docs.title: Module 3 — Analytic Geometry of Data
docs.text: Class 9 – Norms, distances, and similarity measures Class 10 – Inner products and cosine similarity Class 11 – Orthogonality and decorrelation Class 12 – Projections and least-squares fitting Class 13 – Geometry of data clouds

docs.title: Module 4 — Matrix Decompositions
docs.text: Class 14 – Linear operators and invariant directions Class 15 – Eigenvalues and eigenvectors Class 16 – Symmetric matrices and quadratic forms Class 17 – Singular Value Decomposition (SVD) Class 18 – SVD for optimal low-rank data representation

docs.title: Module 5 — Vector Calculus for Learning
docs.text: Class 19 – Multivariate functions and loss surfaces Class 20 – Gradients as directions of steepest descent Class 21 – Hessians, curvature, and conditioning Class 22 – Gradient-based optimization

docs.title: Module 6 — Probability for Data
docs.text: Class 23 – Random variables as data generators Class 24 – Mean, variance, and covariance Class 25 – Multivariate Gaussian distributions Class 26 – Probability as a model of uncertainty

docs.title: Module 7 — When Models Meet Data
docs.text: Class 27 – Training, testing, and generalization Class 28 – Loss functions and risk minimization Class 29 – Overfitting, bias–variance, regularization

docs.title: Module 8 — Linear Regression
docs.text: Class 30 – Linear regression as projection Class 31 – Least-squares and normal equations Class 32 – Ridge regression and stability

docs.title: Module 9 — Principal Component Analysis
docs.text: Class 33 – Variance, covariance, and principal directions Class 34 – Eigenvectors as principal components Class 35 – PCA via SVD Class 36 – Data compression and visualization

docs.title: Module 10 — Gaussian Mixture Models
docs.text: Class 37 – Probabilistic clustering and mixture models Class 38 – Gaussian mixtures Class 39 – Expectation–Maximization (EM) algorithm

docs.title: Textbook
docs.text: Deisenroth, M. P., Faisal, A. A., & Ong, C. S. (2020). Mathematics for Machine Learning. Cambridge University Press.
